MACC says AGC let off Musa in 2012 as a matter of policy  Free Malaysia Today

item.title: MACC calls up Najib over alleged 1MDB report tampering - The Star Online
item.description:
MACC calls up Najib over alleged 1MDB report tampering  The Star Online

PUTRAJAYA: Former prime minister Datuk Seri Najib Razak spent about four hours at the Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) headquarters today (Thursday). Najib was called to give a statement on the allegations that the 1Malaysia Development Berhad (1MDB) final audit report in 2016 had been tampered with. He arrived at MACC headquarters at 10.30am and left at around 2.30pm. On Nov 24, Auditor General Tan Sri Dr Madinah Mohamad alleged that Najib has instructed for amendments to the 1MDB final audit report by taking out several paragraphs. Among the alleged amendments include taking ou...

item.title: MACC trying to find out ‘how and why this happened’ - The Star Online
item.description:
MACC trying to find out ‘how and why this happened’  The Star Online

PUTRAJAYA: Graft investigators are probing various wrongdoing in the alleged “tampering” of the 1MDB final audit report, including determining elements of power abuse among high-ranking officials. More than a dozen officials have been summoned for questioning since investigators were given a copy of the unamended version of the report. Sources said the officials were asked to explain “how and why this had happened”. Among those called up were Tan Sri Shukry Salleh who had served as chief principal private secretary to then prime minister Datuk Seri Najib Tun Razak. Also called to answer que...

item.title: MACC quizzes former chief Dzulkifli - Malaysiakini
item.description:
Malaysiakini

The Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) is questioning its former chief Dzulkifli Ahmad at the commission's headquarters in Putrajaya. It is believed MACC is recording Dzulkifli's statement on the alleged tampering of 1MDB's national audit report. Dzulkifli appeared calm when he arrived at the office at 10.25am and he waved to the media personnel present as he walked into the building. Yesterday, the Public Accounts Committee (PAC) said Dzulkifli would be among those it would question over the alleged tampering. Dzulkifli is not named in the chronological report provided by auditor-...

item.title: Najib at MACC HQ over alleged tampering of 1MDB audit report - The Star Online
item.description:
Najib at MACC HQ over alleged tampering of 1MDB audit report  The Star Online

PUTRAJAYA: Former prime minister Datuk Seri Najib Tun Razak arrived at the Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) headquarters here at 10.30am Thursday (Dec 6), according to MACC sources. Najib was expected to give his statement to graft busters over the alleged tampering of the Auditor-General’s 1MDB final audit report. Aside from Najib, former 1MDB president Arul Kanda Kandasamy, former chief secretary to the government Tan Sri Dr Ali Hamsa, former attorney-general Tan Sri Apandi Ali, and former MACC chief commissioner Tan Sri Dzulkifli Ahmad will also be called up for questioning. O...

item.title: Jho Low refuses to hand over RM10 billion - Malaysia Today
item.description:
Jho Low refuses to hand over RM10 billion  Malaysia Today

And that was why yesterday the government issued a warrant of arrest against Jho Low and four other Chinamen. They are also going for the ex-MACC chief, ex-AG, ex-PAC Chairman, and many more. Daim and Mahathir realise they are not going to see the RM10 billion after all so they might as well go for broke. But will they manage to track down and extradite Jho Low? Maybe, but they are not going to get the RM10 billion which they are seeking. THE CORRIDORS OF POWER Raja Petra Kamarudin The negotiations between Tun Daim Zainuddin, the chairman of the Council of Eminent Persons (CEP), and Low Tae...

item.title: Former MACC chief commissioner Dzulkifli Ahmad summoned to MACC over 1MDB probe - The Star Online
item.description:
Former MACC chief commissioner Dzulkifli Ahmad summoned to MACC over 1MDB probe  The Star Online

PUTRAJAYA (Bernama): Former Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) chief commissioner Tan Sri Dzulkifli Ahmad has been summoned as part of investigations into amendments to the 1Malaysia Development Bhd (1MDB) final audit report. Dzulkifli - who arrived at the MACC headquarters here on Wednesday (Dec 5) at 10.25 am - is among the witnesses sought after the MACC reviewed the original 1MDB final audit report for comparison with the final draft issued by the National Audit Department Malaysia (JANM). On Nov 25, Auditor-General Tan Sri Dr Madinah Mohamad revealed that the 1MDB final audit ...

item.title: Auditor-General submits documents over claims that final 1MDB report was tampered with - The Star Online
item.description:
Auditor-General submits documents over claims that final 1MDB report was tampered with  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: Auditor-General Tan Sri Dr Madinah Mohamad (pic) has handed over documents to the Public Accounts Committee (PAC) to support claims that the 1MDB final audit report was tampered with. Dr Madinah revealed this when met by reporters at the Parliament lobby after spending three-and-a-half hours testifying before the PAC on Wednesday (Dec 5). "I have also handed over documents to the PAC," she said, adding that these documents includes the original audit report on 1MDB. "I have given my explanation to the PAC so it's up to them to conduct further investigations," she said. PAC cha...

item.title: PAC not ruling out possibility of Najib being questioned over alleged tampering with 1MDB report - The Star Online
item.description:
PAC not ruling out possibility of Najib being questioned over alleged tampering with 1MDB report  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: Public Accounts Committee chairman Datuk Seri Ronald Kiandee (pic) is not ruling out the possibility that Datuk Seri Najib Tun Razak might be called up for questioning in its investigation over the alleged tampering into the Auditor General’s 1MDB final audit report. “I’m not dismissing that possibility,” he said briefly to reporters in parliament on Tuesday (Dec 4), when quizzed over the matter. Aside from former prime minister Najib, Dr Kiandee said that former 1MDB president Arul Kanda Kandasamy, former chief secretary to the government Tan Sri Dr Ali Hamsa, former attorn...

item.title: Government offers Rizal Mansor an immunity deal - Malaysia Today
item.description:
Government offers Rizal Mansor an immunity deal  Malaysia Today

The Rizal immunity deal has not been finalised yet. The government first wants to know what he is going to say in his testimony and whether it is strong enough to convict Rosmah. At the end of the day it is going to be a case of he says, she says. THE CORRIDORS OF POWER Raja Petra Kamarudin The government has offered Rizal Mansor a deal. Turn ‘crown witness’ and receive immunity from prosecution. Rizal, together with Rosmah Mansor, has been charged for corruption involving the solar hybrid systems project in Sarawak. However, there is no evidence against Rosmah that can secure her convictio...

item.title: Mahdzir quizzed by MACC for three hours - The Star Online
item.description:
Mahdzir quizzed by MACC for three hours  The Star Online

PUTRAJAYA: Talk of another Umno heavyweight Datuk Seri Mahdzir Khalid being taken to court to face corruption charges proved to be unfounded as the anti-graft body has yet to receive an order. Instead, the former education minister was released after three hours of questioning at the Ma­­laysian Anti-Corruption Commis­sion (MACC) headquarters here. He arrived at about 9.15am yesterday before leaving around 12.30pm. It was the third time that the party vice-president was called in to assist investigations into alleged corruption. Sources said the Padang Terap MP might only be charged next ye...

item.title: Let MACC probe milk programme scandal, says Dr Maszlee - The Star Online
item.description:
Let MACC probe milk programme scandal, says Dr Maszlee  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR (Bernama): Dr Maszlee Malik says he is leaving to the Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) to probe into the loss of milk, worth millions of ringgit, under the 1Malaysia Milk Programme (PS1M) during the previous administration. “We leave to the MACC to make any comments. I do not want to interrupt any investigation,” the Education Minister said when met by reporters at the Parliament lobby on Monday (Nov 19). The National Union of the Teaching Profession (NUTP) had recently queried on the status of the programme, saying that the milk was not distributed to schools since ...

item.title: MACC free to probe ministry - The Star Online
item.description:
MACC free to probe ministry  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: The Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) is free to investigate the Tourism, Arts and Culture Ministry over recent allegations of power abuse, said its Minister Datuk Mohamaddin Ketapi. Amid reports that MACC is probing his ministry after allegations emerged that one of his children was calling the shots in awarding of tenders, the Silam MP maintained that there was “no such thing”. “They can investigate. We are not afraid. We’ve got nothing to hide, nothing at all,” he said when contacted. Mohamaddin said it was MACC’s right to probe allegations of power abuse in the ...

item.title: Malaysia reopens submarine probe, questions former PM Najib - Reuters
item.description:
Malaysia reopens submarine probe, questions former PM Najib  Reuters

Malaysian anti-graft authorities have reopened investigations into a contentious submarine deal 16 years ago involving former prime minister Najib Razak, the latest corruption probe facing the embattled Najib. Since losing a May election, Najib has been charged with multiple criminal offences and has been subject to corruption investigations, some linked to a multi-billion dollar scandal at state fund 1Malaysia Development Berhad (1MDB). Najib has pleaded not guilty to all charges. Investigators with the Malaysian Anti Corruption Commission (MACC) are now also looking at whether there had b...

item.title: Sources: Mahdzir Khalid may be next to face corruption charges - The Star Online
item.description:
Sources: Mahdzir Khalid may be next to face corruption charges  The Star Online

PUTRAJAYA: Former education minister Datuk Seri Mahdzir Khalid could be next in line to be charged by the Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC). Sources say that the case is related to the RM1.25bil solar panel project for rural schools in Sarawak. It is believed that Mahdzir could be charged on Friday (Nov 30) and may be detained by the MACC the night before. However, MACC sources said this is unconfirmed and may be postponed. Mahdzir would be third individual to be charged over the same case. Earlier this month, Datin Seri Rosmah Mansor and her former aide Datuk Rizal Mansor had bot...

item.title: MACC gets VIP visitor - The Star Online
item.description:
MACC gets VIP visitor  The Star Online

PUTRAJAYA: Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan visited the Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) on Wednesday (Nov 21) as part of his two-day official visit to Malaysia. Imran Khan arrived at the commission's headquarters at 3.35pm and was greeted by MACC chief commissioner Datuk Seri Mohd Shukri Abdull. The newly-minted Pakistan premier came after a bilateral meeting followed by a luncheon with Prime Minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad earlier. Imran Khan had said that Pakistan is keen on learning from Malaysia's anti-corruption efforts. The former national cricket star became his countr...

item.title: MACC to investigate tampering of 1MDB audit report - The Star Online
item.description:
MACC to investigate tampering of 1MDB audit report  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: The Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) has begun investigations into allegations that the final audit report on 1Malaysia Development Berhad (1MDB) was altered. In a statement on Sunday (Nov 25), the commission said it will go through the original documents of the report and compare them with the final draft issued by the Auditor-General Department. "In relations to this, the MACC will be calling several witnesses in the near future to testify and help with the investigations," it said. Auditor-General Tan Sri Dr Madinah Mohamad had earlier Sunday said in a statement...

item.title: Ex-Auditor-General Ambrin questioned by MACC over alleged tampering of 1MDB report - The Star Online
item.description:
Ex-Auditor-General Ambrin questioned by MACC over alleged tampering of 1MDB report  The Star Online

PUTRAJAYA: Former Auditor-General Tan Sri Ambrin Buang (pic) has been called up by anti-corruption investigators over the alleged tampering of the 1Malaysia Development Berhad (1MDB) audit report. Sources in the Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) said Ambrin arrived at the commission's headquarters here at 3.15pm on Monday (Nov 26). MACC had said in a statement on Sunday that it will probe allegations that the final audit report on 1MDB was altered. The statement came after current Auditor-General Tan Sri Dr Madinah Mohamad revealed that several changes were made to the final repor...

item.title: FIFA ethics judge Sundra Rajoo detained by MACC - The Star Online
item.description:
FIFA ethics judge Sundra Rajoo detained by MACC  The Star Online

BRUSSELS: A Fifa Ethics Committee judge was arrested on suspicion of corruption in his native Malaysia and has resigned as director of an arbitration service, his lawyer and reports said Wednesday (Nov 21). Prof Dr Sundra Rajoo (pic) was detained late Tuesday (Nov 20) by anti-graft investigators after flying in from Zurich, where Fifa has its headquarters, to assist in a corruption probe. He was held overnight, but released after a court accepted his representatives’ arguments that he effectively has diplomatic immunity due to his high-profile legal roles, lawyer Cheow Wee told AFP. As well...

item.title: MACC arrests four Immigration officers - The Star Online
item.description:
MACC arrests four Immigration officers  The Star Online

JOHOR BARU: Four immigration officers, including one with a Datuk title, are among five people arrested for allegedly taking bribes to approve Visit Pass for Temporary Employment (VPTE) and Professional Visit Pass. The immigration officers, including a woman, between 38 and 46 years old, have been remanded for four days to assist in investigations. The fifth suspect arrested and remanded is a 50-year-old businessman. It is learnt that the Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) arrested a senior immigration officer at his office in Setia Tropika at 10am on Sunday. Three other immigratio...

item.title: Melaka exco member hands over 7 files about alleged corruption to AG and MACC - The Star Online
item.description:
Melaka exco member hands over 7 files about alleged corruption to AG and MACC  The Star Online

MELAKA: The Melaka Agriculture, Entrepreneur Development and Agro-Based committee chairman has handed over seven files about corruption allegedly committed by the previous state administration to the Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) and the Attorney General. Norhizam Hassan Baktee said that the files contained information about three serving assemblymen who allegedly abused their positions to enrich themselves when they were part of the previous state administration. Melaka has 13 opposition assemblymen from Umno. He said that he personally handed over the files to MACC chief com...

item.title: Three businessmen detained for attempted bribery in Kluang - The Star Online
item.description:
Three businessmen detained for attempted bribery in Kluang  The Star Online

KLUANG: The Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) has arrested three businessmen for attempting to bribe a municipal council enforcement officer here. MACC arrested the three suspects, aged between 40 and 60, at its Kluang branch office here on Sunday (Nov 18) at around 8pm to assist with investigations. They are alleged to have given RM1,500 in cash to a Kluang Municipal Council (MPK) enforcement officer as an inducement not to take action against them. The suspects had allegedly committed an offence under the Local Government Act 1976 under the offences of the Licensing, Business...

item.title: Baling MP being questioned by MACC - The Star Online
item.description:
Baling MP being questioned by MACC  The Star Online

PUTRAJAYA: Baling MP Datuk Seri Abdul Azeez Rahim is being questioned by Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) investigators here. MACC sources said the former Tabung Haji chairman was called up for questioning on Tuesday (Nov 27). Abdul Azeez arrived at the MACC headquarters at 3.05pm in a white MPV, which bore a Member of Parliament badge. The Umno supreme council member was previously arrested by the MACC in September and remanded for a total of 10 days. He was being investigated over allegations that he had demanded kickbacks to help interested parties secure government contrac...

item.title: Malaysia says former PM Najib's office ordered changes to 1MDB audit report - Reuters
item.description:
Malaysia says former PM Najib's office ordered changes to 1MDB audit report  Reuters

The office of former Malaysian premier Najib Razak ordered changes to a 2016 audit report of scandal-plagued state fund 1MDB, including removing mention of financier Low Taek Jho's presence at a board meeting, authorities said. Financier Low has been described as a central player in the alleged corruption and money laundering at 1MDB, according to Malaysian and U.S. authorities investigating the fund. He had no official role in 1MDB, but advised on investments and negotiated deals for the fund, the authorities have said. Najib, ousted in a May 9 election by Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad, ...

item.title: KJ: Disappointing if Najib ordered report changed - The Star Online
item.description:
KJ: Disappointing if Najib ordered report changed  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: It will be a disappointment if embattled former premier Datuk Seri Najib Tun Razak, who is facing ongoing graft charges, had indeed ordered the 1Malaysia Development Bhd (1MDB) audit report to be tampered with, says Umno stalwart Khairy Jamaluddin. “If there is an order to erase Jho Low’s attendance at 1MDB board meetings, then it is a serious move which is disappointing,” he said, referring to fugitive businessman Low Taek Jho. “The presence of Jho Low in 1MDB board meetings was never reported to the then Barisan Nasional Cabinet ministers before,” he said when met at the Par...

item.title: MACC to charge more former ministers - The Star Online
item.description:
MACC to charge more former ministers  The Star Online

PUTRAJAYA: The spate of charging former leaders for corruption continues. Two ex-ministers are set to be hauled to court in the coming weeks. Former education minister Datuk Seri Mahdzir Khalid is expected to be charged on Friday over the RM2.5bil solar power project for Sarawak rural schools, say Malay­sian Anti-Corruption Com­mission (MACC) sources. Meanwhile, former federal territories minister Datuk Seri Tengku Adnan Tengku Mansor is expected to be brought to court to face charges again, this time involving land sale in Kuala Lumpur. A date is currently being fixed, sources said. The MA...

item.title: AG: Vinayak Pradhan appointed acting director of Asian International Arbitration Centre - The Star Online
item.description:
AG: Vinayak Pradhan appointed acting director of Asian International Arbitration Centre  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Vinayak Pradhan (pic) has been appointed the acting director of the Asian International Arbitration Centre (AIAC) following the resignation of Datuk Prof Dr Sundra Rajoo. In a statement on Wednesday (Nov 21), Attorney General Tommy Thomas said he has known Vinayak for decades and can vouch for his integrity and will enhance the standing of the AIAC in the domestic and international arena. "I am confident he will lead AIAC to lofty heights," he said. He said Vinayak, who was called to the Malaysian Bar in 1974 after earning his Bachelor of Laws degree from the University of Si...

item.title: We’re here to learn from Malaysia, says Imran - The Star Online
item.description:
We’re here to learn from Malaysia, says Imran  The Star Online

PUTRAJAYA: The governments of Pakistan and Malaysia have a lot in common. Both are headed by a Prime Minister who swept to power after having ousted the incumbent, on the back of overwhelming support to wipe out corruption. Both Prime Ministers inherited a country with large national debt and are popular personalities in and outside their countries. Malaysia’s Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad created history when he became the world’s oldest Prime Minister at 93 while Imran Khan is the first professional cricketer to go on and lead the country where the game is hugely popular. Battling corruption an...

item.title: Najib back at MACC, believed over S'wak electricity project - The Star Online
item.description:
Najib back at MACC, believed over S'wak electricity project  The Star Online

PUTRAJAYA: Datuk Seri Najib Tun Razak has been summoned again to meet graft investigators, this time over what is believed to be the project to provide electricity to rural schools in Sarawak that has already entangled his wife. He was seen entering the Malaysian Anti Corruption Commission headquarters at 9.22am on Monday (Nov 19). Najib is already facing close to 40 court chargers of corruption, money laundering and power abuse. Najib's wife Datin Seri Rosmah Mansor has already been charged with two counts of corruption over the project, said to be worth RM1. 25bil. Rosmah is said to have ...

item.title: Three businessmen charged with attempt to bribe Kluang council officers - The Star Online
item.description:
Three businessmen charged with attempt to bribe Kluang council officers  The Star Online

JOHOR BARU: Three businessmen were charged at the Sessions Court here with attempting to offer bribes amounting to RM1,6000 to Kluang Municipal Council (MPK) enforcement officers. The accused, Daniel Chew Zen Yuen, 32; Cheong Siau Ming, 50; and Chung Kok Yeow, 68, were arrested at the Kluang Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) office on Nov 18 at 8pm. Chew and Chung pleaded guilty while Cheong claimed trial. Cheong, who was charged with two offences, was represented by lawyer Datuk Mandave Singh Gill, while the other two were unrepresented. In the first charge, Cheong was accused of...

item.title: Dr M says ‘not aware’ of MACC’s move to reopen probe into Scorpene submarine purchase - The Star Online
item.description:
Dr M says ‘not aware’ of MACC’s move to reopen probe into Scorpene submarine purchase  The Star Online

PUTRAJAYA: Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad says he is not aware that investigation on the purchase of French submarine Scorpene has been reopened. The Prime Minister said the decision to re-examine the case is the prerogative of the anti-graft authorities. "This is an old case but if the MACC found that there is some hanky-panky, they have the authority to reopen it. "But I am not aware that it (the case) has been reopened. I only read what you (media) write,” he said after chairing the Special Cabinet Committee on Anti-Corruption on Wednesday (Nov 21). On Monday (Nov 19), the Malaysian Anti-Corrup...

item.title: Ku Nan leaves MACC HQ, heading to court to face graft charges - The Star Online
item.description:
Ku Nan leaves MACC HQ, heading to court to face graft charges  The Star Online

PUTRAJAYA: Former Federal Territories minister Datuk Seri Tengku Adnan Tengku Mansor has left for the Kuala Lumpur Sessions Court to face corruption charges. He was seen leaving the Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) headquarters in a black Toyota Alphard at 1.25pm on Thursday (Nov 15). The Putrajaya MP will be charged with businessman Datuk Tan Eng Boon over the Kuala Lumpur City Hall land deal. The former Umno secretary-general, who had been questioned 12 times by investigators over the land deals, was arrested Wednesday (Nov 14) when he arrived at the MACC headquarters to have h...

item.title: Corruption is getting worse, says MACC chief - The Star Online
item.description:
Corruption is getting worse, says MACC chief  The Star Online

PUTRAJAYA: Corruption in Malaysia is worsening and is an embarrassment to the country, Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) chief commissioner Datuk Seri Mohd Shukri Abdull (pic) said. There was no point in toning things down when facts and figures clearly showed that corruption was on the rise in the country, he said. “Usually when we are asked about the level of corruption in Malaysia, people tend to not be honest and instead claim that it is in a controllable state. “But I am not the type to pretend. I will be very frank. Corruption in Malaysia is at a worrying level. “The fact is...

item.title: MACC Chief ashamed he is Malaysian - Malaysia Today
item.description:
MACC Chief ashamed he is Malaysian  Malaysia Today

Malaysia ranks 62 in the corruption index against Indonesia’s far higher 96 but Shukri prefers to be called Indonesian rather than Malaysian (TMI) – MACC chief commissioner Mohd Shukri Abdull recounted today that he felt so embarrassed about Malaysia’s corruption levels when on a trip abroad in 2016 that he pretended to be an Indonesian national. “When someone asked me in English where I was from, I was ashamed to say I was from Malaysia, so I said I was an Indonesian. “That was our state of (corruption) at that time,” he told a forum in Putrajaya this morning. Shukri, who has more than thr...

item.title: Businessman remanded for impersonating MACC officer to get RM2mil bribe from a Datuk Seri - The Star Online
item.description:
Businessman remanded for impersonating MACC officer to get RM2mil bribe from a Datuk Seri  The Star Online

PUTRAJAYA: A 48-year-old man has been remanded for six days for posing as an anti-graft buster to solicit a RM2mil bribe from a Datuk Seri. Magistrate Shah Wira Abdul Hakim allowed an application by Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) prosecutors to hold him in custody until Nov 18. The businessman is the fifth person to have been nabbed by the MACC for impersonating commission officers. The man was arrested at 10.22pm on Monday (Nov 12) in the midst of giving his statement. The men are said to have tried to solicit a RM2mil bribe from the Datuk Seri, who was believed to have a case...
